beer.brewersTips: Add virgin white oak chips soaked in a Reposado Tequila to give it a "South of the Wall" kick.

beer.name: Off-Duty Alien
beer.description: Off-Duty Alien is a citrus IPA, brewed with blood orange and grapefruit to enhance the citurs characteristics of the hops.
beer.brewersTips: Adding the orange and grapefruit peels to the mash gently extracts the essential oils from the peel but leaves the bitter pith behind in the spent grain.

beer.name: East Of Vermont
beer.description: A Vermont IPA with fruit and milk sugars added - recreating fruity milkshake character in an IPA.

foodPairings.food: Thai sweet potato and carrot soup

beer.brewersTips: If you use mango pulp, extend the time that you whirlpool to let it settle out. Trying to clean mango pulp out of your heat exchanger or cooling coil is not a fun ending to a brewday.

beer.name: Declassified Demi-God
beer.description: An exclusive barrel-aged blend, brought together to reward investors on Equity for Punks USA; two imperial stouts aged in grain whisky barrels for over a year.
beer.brewersTips: The lactose kettle addition is unfermentable by yeast. Target a pre-boil OG of between 90 and 100, then use the lactose to increase it to the target OG.

beer.name: Raspberry Popsicle Parade
beer.description: A draft-only kettle-soured raspberry ale, brewed to just 0.5% ABV, using our knowledge from brewing both Blitz and Nanny State. Aromas of fresh raspberry juice, soft red berries, and a blast of lemon zest, with a juicy palate encompassing zingy acidity and the smooth velvety note of oats, rounding out this low-ABV juicebox.

foodPairings.food: Walnut and goat's cheese salad with pomegranate dressing

beer.brewersTips: If you don’t need it to be low ABV, try tripling the amount of malt to get more body. Experiment with different sources for lactic acid bacteria, like unpasteurised yogurt or sour dough.

beer.name: Indie Pale Ale
beer.description: A non-dry-hopped pale ale, using new hopping technqiues and in- depth fermentation know-how.
beer.brewersTips: This beer is charactised by the subtle aromas derived from yeast. Ensure you have fresh healthy yeast and good temperature control to replicate these flavours.

beer.name: Small Batch: Dry-hopped Pilsner
beer.description: A BrewDog bar exclusive draft lager, brewed with Weihenstephan's lager yeast, and dry-hopped with the contemporary German variety Saphir; this lager has been lightly centrifuged and packaged at just under 28 days in tank.
beer.brewersTips: Before dry hopping, if you aren't happy with the "green" beer, drink it (or dump it) and make a new one to avoid wasting your premium hops on something flawed.

beer.name: Hazy Jane Bourbon Barrel Aged
beer.description: A draft-only BrewDog bar exclusive; we have experimented with ageing our Vermount IPA for a short time in bourbon and rye barrels, both known for imparting flavour quickly compared to other types of barrel.

hop.name: American Oak Wood- chip medium toast, Ageing soaked in Bourbon

beer.brewersTips: Avoid any oxygen uptake! It will oxidise the delicate hop flavours during the ageing period. Purge your barrel/ageing vessel with CO2 and seal it airtight.

beer.name: Hazy Jane Rye Barrel Aged
beer.description: A draft-only BrewDog bar exclusive; we have experimented with ageing our Vermount IPA for a short time in bourbon and rye barrels, both known for imparting flavour quickly compared to other types of barrel.

foodPairings.food: Orange and carrot cake with orange cream cheese icing

hop.name: American Oak Wood- chip medium toast, Ageing soaked in Rye Whisky

beer.brewersTips: Avoid any oxygen uptake! It will oxidise the delicate hop flavours during the ageing period. Purge your barrel/ageing vessel with CO2 and seal it airtight.

beer.name: Karma Cloud
beer.description: A draft-only exclusive beer for International markets as part of the DogDealers programme. Karma Cloud is a tropical IPA, designed to cram as much fruit flavour in as possible using only hops to recreate those flavours.

foodPairings.food: Roasted pork loin with tropical fruit

beer.brewersTips: Using the latest year's hops is a must. Leave the beer conditioning on the hops for a maximum of 5 days, otherwise there is a risk of a green vegetal like character being extracted.

beer.name: Native Son
beer.description: A big, dank, double IPA, sitting in the 8-9% ABV bracket, in our Amplified range - filling a gap that has been sitting empty since Hardcore IPA departed. A new beer developed by our Head of Production Jason Pond; the first brew he came up with since joining became an instant hit.
beer.brewersTips: This beer is very hop centric. Use the youngest hops that are available and store them in a freezer. This will help slow the degradation of desirable hop compounds.

beer.name: AB:25
beer.description: A super-smooth, full-bodied chewy- as-hell barley wine. Our latest concept brew spent 6 months drawing flavour from bourbon barrels.

foodPairings.food: Coarse pork pate with fresh crusty bread
Beef burger topped with red onions and wasabi

beer.brewersTips: Waxing the bottle/cap helps to exclude oxygen ingress through the cap if you are looking to cellar the beer for a long time.

beer.name: Kamikaze Knitting Club
beer.description: Our first 2018 Wildcard brew, Kamikaze Knitting Club is a one-off brew. A maple stout, Kamikaze combines dark malts with a classic Canadian export, adding to the warming malty and smokey character.
beer.brewersTips: Try experimenting with fenugreek seeds which give off a maple syrup like flavour.

beer.name: Very Big Moose
beer.description: BrewDog vs Fierce Beer. A rebrew of the Fierce Beer & Flagship bar Collabfest 2017 winning beer, Very Big Moose is being scaled up to our Ellon brewhouse.

foodPairings.food: Rich vanilla ice cream. Neat (or make a float)
Roast venison with a chocolate sauce
The biggest darkest chocolate cake you can find

beer.brewersTips: Its probably best to parti-gyle this beer as this will have a run off time of 6 hours+!!! Set up the mash and see what is collected overnight, then add more hot water to do your second mash and make a low (3%) beer from your residual extract.

beer.name: Paradox Islay 2018
beer.description: Our longest running beer series, Paradox sees us ageing an Imperial Stout in different types of cask. This one showcases grain whisky.

method.twist: Age this beer in Rye Whisky Casks.

foodPairings.food: Roast beef with a herb and malt crust

beer.brewersTips: Brew this as part of a parti gyle mash, making this beer from your first runnings. It will take a long time to run off and be prepared to add dextrose to reach your target OG.

beer.name: Clockwork Tangerine
beer.description: Winner of the 2017 Prototype Challenge, ClockWork Tangerine is a session strength IPA, infused with tangerine, and appears as our new Q2 Seasonal, replacing Hop Fiction.

foodPairings.food: Light and fluffy tangerine sponge cake
Fresh green salad with avocados and pomegranate seeds

beer.brewersTips: Try your own fruit series with this beer. Grapefruit, Passionfruit, Rapberries or Morello Cherries would be great.

beer.name: Sonic Boom
beer.description: Welcome aboard our experimental range of tuned IPAs. Buckle up for an explosive sensory bombardment. Tropical fruit and resinous pine are primed. The first wave of pineapple, melon and mango quickly accelerate into a afterburner of candied citrus fruit and sweet caramel. Sonic Boom - IPA turning at the speed of sound.
beer.brewersTips: This IPA features German hops in the dry hop. Why not try a Slovenian only version using: Dana, Bobek, Aurora & Cascade.

beer.name: Dog G
beer.description: Dog G is a benchmark in liquid form; our 11th anniversary beer. A 17% imperial stout brewed with a compelling mix of dark malts, chillies, cacao and coffee - to make it a true milestone we then decided to age Dog G in rye whiskey barrels.
beer.brewersTips: Age this beer!!! Often it will pick up new incredible flavours after an extended cellaring. Think 2 years plus.

beer.name: Mallow Mafia
beer.description: BrewDog vs Amundsen. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. With Norwegian craft brewers Amundsen, we are creating a mash-up of two existing beers, resulting in a coffee, chocolate and marshmallow Russian Imperial Stout.
beer.brewersTips: If your mash run off takes a long time, increase the temperature of your sparge water to keep the mash bed warm and permeable.

beer.name: Manic Mango
beer.description: BrewDog v Brewski. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. Our Swedish collaboration with Brewski is a mango IPA.

foodPairings.food: Pho soup with light rice noodles

beer.brewersTips: Add the mango puree towards the end of primary fermentation, about 10 SG points above your FG. Allow it to reach FG and have a diacetyl rest before dry hopping it.

beer.name: Baltic Fleet
beer.description: BrewDog vs Bevog. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. Our Austrian collaboration is with Bevog, and incorporates plum into a Baltic porter.
beer.brewersTips: Double Roasted Crystal is used when the astringency and bitterness inherent to roast malts is not desired. This means that it can be used at a higher rate in the grist to add complex caramel and dried fruit notes with a beautiful red-brown hue.

beer.name: SOS! (May Day!)
beer.description: BrewDog vs Brlo. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. Our German collaboration is with BRLO, and the beer is a dry- hopped Maibock; a new world take on a strong pale lager.
beer.brewersTips: Traditional German brewing is awesome and deserving of respect. If you brew this during spring time, call it a Maibock, any other time of the year and it should be called an Helles Bock.

beer.name: Al Adjore!
beer.description: BrewDog vs La Pirata. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. Our collab with Spanish brewes La Pirata features a barley wine, inspired by Muscatel.
beer.brewersTips: Sanitise the oak chips before adding them to the fermenter. Vodka is ideal as it’s a neutral spirit and can be drained off. If you don’t want to affect the ABV, try steaming them.

beer.name: Neverland
beer.description: BrewDog vs Oedipus. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. This India pale lager has been brewed with Dutch brewers Oedipus.

foodPairings.food: Spicy jalapeño and seared steak fajitas

beer.brewersTips: Acidulated malt was first produced to circumvent the Reinheitsgebot in Germany where they could not acidify their brewing water. A weak organic acid such as lactic acid can be used in its place.

beer.name: Grano Giusto
beer.description: BrewDog vs Birrificiano Italiano. One of a series of collaborations with European craft breweries, aimed at promoting engagement and market growth. Our Italian collaboration is with Birrificiano Italiano, and the beer is a dark lager brewed with a unique dark malt from an Italian micro-maltster.
beer.brewersTips: Grano dei Miracoli is a unique ancient grain and shouldn't be substituted, this beer is focused on what this ingredient offers when paired with modern malts.

beer.name: King of Eights
beer.description: A new 7.4% ABV East Coast IPA, King of Eights is one of the core Fanzine beers, and will feature evolving editions as part of our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Pectin powder can easily be sourced and is an easy alternative for a homebrewer to produce murky beer if you don’t have access to a low flocculating yeast.

beer.name: Jinx Pale Ale
beer.description: A new 4.7% ABV American pale ale, Jinx Pale Ale is one of the core Fanzine beers, and will feature evolving editions as part of our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Rack this into a corny keg, cool it down and carbonate it with 10 PSI of top pressure for 10 days. Should be super drinkable.

beer.name: Jet Trash
beer.description: A new 6.9% ABV West Coast IPA, Jet Trash is one of the core Fanzine beers, and will feature evolving editions as part of our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Split this batch and try fermenting the other half with WLP008 East Coast Ale, dry hop whilst primary fermentation is going and have an East Coast IPA to compare with.

beer.name: Interstate Vienna Lager.
beer.description: A new 5% ABV Vienna Lager, that features in Fanzine, our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Instead of using Pilsner, try to substitute this out for more Vienna malt. This is more traditional but you should calculate your diastatic power for your new mash. Ideally it should be a minimum of 30 to 50 Lintner.

beer.name: Fools Gold Dortmunder Lager
beer.description: A new 5.6% Dortmunder Lager, that featues in Fanzine, our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Make sure you burtonise your water as Dortmund's water contains a fairly high amount of sulphates. Carbonate this to approximately 2.6 volumes

beer.name: Zipcode
beer.description: A new 5% Pilsner, that feaures in Fanzine, our new subscription model.
beer.brewersTips: Saphir hops are not widespread at the moment if you cannot get hold of any, a good batch of Mittlefruh is a fair substitute.
